title.native: 魔法使いの嫁 星待つひと
title.romaji: Mahoutsukai no Yome: Hoshi Matsu Hito
title.english: The Ancient Magus' Bride: Those Awaiting a Star

description:
The three-part OVA series will chronicle a story taking place before Chise meets the Magus.
Chise Hatori has lived a life full of neglect and abuse, devoid of anything resembling love. Far from the warmth of family, she has had her share of troubles and pitfalls. Just when all hope seems lost, a fateful encounter awaits her. When a man with the head of a beast, wielding strange powers, obtains her through a slave auction, Chise's life will never be the same again.

(Source: Seven Seas Entertainment)
synonyms: Mahou Tsukai no Yome: Hoshi Matsu Hito

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Skeleton
tags.description: Prominently features skeleton(s) as a character.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

Junichi Matsumoto is a composer, arranger and keyboardist. He graduated from Kunitachi College of Music.
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.

[Instagram](http://www.instagram.com/leonardosanthos) | [Twitter](http://www.twitter.com/leonardosanthos) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/leonardosanthos) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@FalaCritica) | [Twitch](http://www.twitch.tv/FalaCritica)

Leonardo Santhos is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, and streamer.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Blitzcrank, the Great Steam Golem / Kog'Maw, The Mouth of the Abyss / Vel'Koz, the Eye of the Void / Wukong, the Monkey King (League of Legends)
- Pierce Wheels (Ben 10: Alien Force)
- Peter "Pete" Devin / Master Carter (BONDiNG)
- Agent Bratcher (Outer Banks)
- Henrich Zemo / Baron Zemo (1st voice; The Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes)
- Soren (The Dragon Prince)
- Myst (Grand Chase: Dimensional Chaser)
- Spartan Jared Miller (Halo 4)
- Tetsuya Fukazawa (Ju-On: Origins)
- Kyd Miller (1st voice - 10th season; The X-Files)
- Onix (Gears of War: Judgement)
!~
Gunji Mikio is a producer, production manager and publicity manager. He is an executive at Production I.G.
Director/COO at I.G Port Inc. and President and founder of Mag Garden.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/石川光久)

Co-founder and representative director of [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). The studio is named after him and [Takayuki Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/103266/).

Ishikawa acted as executive producer for the anime sequence The Origin of Ren in Kill Bill, and was the producer of the first two [Ghost in the Shell](https://anilist.co/anime/43/) films. In 2005, Ishikawa joined his first joint Japanese-U.S. collaboration, since the opening of the Production I.G branch in Los Angeles, IGPX: Immortal Grand Prix, a joint production with Production I.G and Cartoon Network. Ishikawa has also produced Batman: Gotham Knight, Halo Legends and Dante's Inferno: An Animated Epic.

He also served as an executive at Bee Train from 1997 to 2006.

(Source: Wikipedia)
Hirotsugu Ose is a producer and advertiser.
Yuusuke Ueda is a producer.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐々木史朗_(音楽プロデューサー%29) | [Flying Dog](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/)

The founder of record label [flying DOG](https://anilist.co/studio/464/flying-DOG).
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/田村せいき)

__Residency:__ Setagaya Ward, Tokyo, Japan
__Graduated:__ Waseda University

__[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/people/%E4%BC%8A%E8%97%A4%E5%B0%86%E7%94%9F/100003056717997)__

__Shousei Itou__ is a Japanese producer working for the company  FlyingDog, Inc.
Yoshihiro Iida is a magazine editor.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/piromegane)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/).

Affiliated with [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

She started off as a painter in the early '80s, and then switched to photography work. Stopped doing photography when animation switched to digital and nowadays just focuses on special effects.

Titular member of Team Taniguchi, a subsidiary of [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) specializing in special effects.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gwada_wit)

President of [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Co-founder and representative director of [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).
